intro: Satureja andrei, commonly known as Armenian savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls and range in color from pink to purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine and cuisine, valued for their pungent, slightly peppery aroma.
